metadata.synopsis: Filmmaker Derek Jarman ponders his deteriorating condition from AIDS, set against a plain blue screen.

reviews: Blue remains an intense and moving tribute to the woman at its centre who, in coming back from tragedy, almost refuses, but ultimately accepts the only real love that's on offer.
Derek Jarman's filmic essay on his own blindness and impending death is a monochromatic elegy to a director's loss of vision.
